refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ArvCamera is a class for the generic control of cameras. It hides the complexity of the genicam interface by providing a simple API, with the drawback of not exposing all the available features. See ArvDevice and ArvGc for a more advanced use of the Aravis library.

example.title: Example use of the ArvCamera API

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_CHECK_VERSION()
refsect2.para: Checks the version of the Aravis library that is being compiled against.

entry.para: the major version to check for
the minor version to check for
the micro version to check for

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the version of the Aravis header files is the same as or newer than the passed-in version.

refsect2.title: arv_get_major_version ()
refsect2.para: Returns the major version number of the Aravis library.
For example, in Aravis version 0.8.20 this is 0.

This function is in the library, so it represents the Aravis library your code is running against. Contrast with the ARAVIS_MAJOR_VERSION macro, which represents the major version of the Aravis headers you have included when compiling your code.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the major version number of the Aravis library

refsect2.title: arv_get_micro_version ()
refsect2.para: Returns the micro version number of the Aravis library.
For example, in Aravis version 0.8.20 this is 20.

This function is in the library, so it represents the Aravis library your code is running against. Contrast with the ARAVIS_MICRO_VERSION macro, which represents the micro version of the Aravis headers you have included when compiling your code.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the micro version number of the Aravis library

refsect2.title: arv_get_minor_version ()
refsect2.para: Returns the minor version number of the Aravis library.
For example, in Aravis version 0.8.20 this is 8.

This function is in the library, so it represents the Aravis library your code is running against. Contrast with the ARAVIS_MINOR_VERSION macro, which represents the minor version of the Aravis headers you have included when compiling your code.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the minor version number of the Aravis library

refsect2.title: arv_camera_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new ArvCamera. If name is null, it will instantiate the first available camera.
If the camera is a GigEVision, name can be either:
If the camera is a USB3Vision device, name is either:

refsect3.para: a new ArvStream, to be freed after use with g_object_unref().

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_region ()
refsect2.programlisting: void arv_camera_set_region (ArvCamera *camera, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Defines the region of interest which will be transmitted in the video stream. Negative x or y values, or not strictly positive width or height values are ignored.

warning.para: arv_camera_acquisition() sets the camera in SingleFrame acquisition mode. You may have to put back the camera in Continuous acquisition mode for later operations, using arv_camera_set_acquisition_mode().

entry.para: acquisition timeout in s. Zero means no timeout.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_frame_rate ()
refsect2.para: Configures a fixed frame rate mode. Once acquisition start is triggered, the video stream will be acquired with the given frame rate. A negative or zero frame_rate value disables the frame rate limit.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: actual frame rate, in Hz.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_trigger ()
refsect2.para: Configures the camera in trigger mode. Typical values for source are "Line1" or "Line2". See the camera documentation for the allowed values. Source can also be "Software". In this case, an acquisition is triggered by a call to arv_camera_software_trigger().
The trigger set is "FrameStart". "AcquisitionStart" is used as a fallback if "FrameStart" is not present. All other triggers are disabled. "TriggerActivation" is set to rising edge.
For an advanced trigger configuration, use the underlying ArvDevice object returned by arv_camera_get_device().

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_trigger_source ()
refsect2.para: Sets the trigger source. This function doesn't check if the camera is configured to actually use this source as a trigger.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_get_trigger_source ()
refsect2.para: Gets the trigger source. This function doesn't check if the camera is configured to actually use this source as a trigger.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string containing the trigger source name, NULL on error.

a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_range_check_policy ()
refsect2.para: Sets the feature range check policy. When enabled, before being set, the value of all nodes with an ArvGcFloat or ArvGcInteger interface will be checked against their Min and Max properties.

warning.para: Be aware that some camera may have wrong definition of Min and Max, as this check is defined as not mandatory in the Genicam specification. If this is the case, it will not possible to set the value of the features with faulty Min or Max definition. Range check is disabled by default.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_register_cache_policy ()
refsect2.para: Sets the Genicam register cache policy.

warning.para: Be aware that some camera may have wrong Cachable properties defined in their Genicam metadata, which may lead to incorrect readouts. Using the debug cache policy, and activating genicam debug output (export ARV_DEBUG=genicam), can help you to check the cache validity. In this mode, every time the cache content is not in sync with the actual register value, a debug message is printed on the console.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if camera is a GigEVision device.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the number of supported stream channels.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_gv_select_stream_channel ()
refsect2.para: Select the current stream channel. Negative channel_id is ignored.

entry.para: id of the channel to select
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The current stream channel id.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The inter packet delay, in nanoseconds.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_gv_set_packet_delay ()
refsect2.para: Configure the inter packet delay to insert between each packet for the current stream channel. This can be used as a crude flow-control mechanism if the application or the network infrastructure cannot keep up with the packets coming from the device. Negative delay_ns is ignored.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The stream packet size, in bytes.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_gv_set_packet_size ()
refsect2.para: Specifies the stream packet size, in bytes, to send on the selected channel for a GVSP transmitter or specifies the maximum packet size supported by a GVSP receiver.

This does not include data leader and data trailer and the last data packet which might be of smaller size (since packet size is not necessarily a multiple of block size for stream channel). Negative packet_size is ignored.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_gv_auto_packet_size ()
refsect2.para: Automatically determine the biggest packet size that can be used data streaming, and set GevSCPSPacketSize value accordingly. This function relies on the GevSCPSFireTestPacket feature. If this feature is not available, the packet size will be set to a default value (1500 bytes).

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The packet size, in bytes.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_gv_set_packet_size_adjustment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the option for packet size adjustment that happens at stream object creation.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_gv_set_stream_options ()
refsect2.para: Sets the options used during stream object creation. These options mus be set before the call to arv_camera_create_stream().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if camera is a USB3Vision device.

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.para: the current bandwidth limit

a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if chunk data are available

refsect2.title: arv_camera_get_chunk_mode ()
refsect2.para: Check wether chunk data mode is active. Please see arv_camera_set_chunk_mode().

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if chunk data mode is active.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_get_chunk_state ()
refsect2.para: Gets state of chunk data. Chunk data are be embedded in ArvBuffer only if chunk mode is active. Please see arv_camera_set_chunk_mode().

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if chunk is enabled.

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_chunk_mode ()
refsect2.para: Controls wether chunk data mode is active. When active, chunk data are appended to image data in ArvBuffer. A ArvChunkParser must be used in order to extract chunk data.

entry.para: wether to enable chunk data mode
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_chunk_state ()
refsect2.para: Sets state of a chunk data. Chunk data are be embedded in ArvBuffer only if chunk mode is active. Please see arv_camera_set_chunk_mode().

entry.para: a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_set_chunks ()
refsect2.para: Convenience function for enabling a set of chunk data. Chunk mode is activated, or deactivated if chunk_list is NULL or empty. All chunk data not listed are disabled.

entry.para: chunk data names, as a comma or space separated list
a GError placeholder, NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: arv_camera_create_chunk_parser ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new ArvChunkParser object, used for the extraction of chunk data from ArvBuffer.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new ArvChunkParser.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_VERSION
refsect2.para: The version of the Aravis library.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_API_VERSION
refsect2.para: The version of the Aravis library API.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_MAJOR_VERSION
refsect2.para: The major version of the Aravis library.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_MICRO_VERSION
refsect2.para: The micor version of the Aravis library.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_MINOR_VERSION
refsect2.para: The minor version of the Aravis library.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_HAS_PACKET_SOCKET
refsect2.para: ARAVIS_HAS_PACKET_SOCKET is defined as 1 if aravis is compiled with packet socket support, 0 if not.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_HAS_USB
refsect2.para: ARAVIS_HAS_USB is defined as 1 if aravis is compiled with USB support, 0 if not.

refsect2.title: ARAVIS_HAS_FAST_HEARTBEAT
refsect2.para: ARAVIS_HAS_FAST_HEARTBEAT is defined as 1 if aravis is compiled with fast hearbeat option, 0 if not.

entry.para: automatic setting done once, then returns to manual
adjust packet size if test packet check fails the with current packet size, only on the first stream creation
adjust packet size if test packet check fails with current packet size
adjust packet size on the first stream creation
always adjust the stream packet size
frames are captured continuously until stopped with the AcquisitionStop command.
only one frame will be acquired
the number of frames specified by AcquisitionFrameCount is captured.
disables the Exposure and let the shutter open.
timed exposure. The exposure duration time is set using the ExposureTime or ExposureAuto features and the exposure starts with the FrameStart or LineStart.

uses the width of the current Frame or Line trigger signal(s) pulse to control the exposure duration. Note that if the Frame or Line TriggerActivation is RisingEdge or LevelHigh, the exposure duration will be the time the trigger stays High. If TriggerActivation is FallingEdge or LevelLow, the exposure time will last as long as the trigger stays Low.

uses one or more trigger signal(s) to control the exposure duration independently from the current Frame or Line triggers. See ExposureStart, ExposureEnd and ExposureActive of the TriggerSelector feature.

refsect2.title: The name property
refsect2.para: Internal device name for object construction
